abstract: A cascade of delayed and canceled flights on Monday was the latest example of how a failure in an airline’s system can have catastrophic effects.
snippet: A cascade of delayed and canceled flights on Monday was the latest example of how a failure in an airline’s system can have catastrophic effects.
lead_paragraph: Delta Air Lines is working to reset its operations on Tuesday morning, after a power failure grounded flights and led to cancellations and delays a day earlier. As of 12:30 p.m. Eastern time, Delta had canceled more than 500 flights scheduled for Tuesday.

headline.main: Delta Malfunction on Land Keeps a Fleet of Planes From the Sky
headline.print_headline: When a Small Malfunction on Land  Keeps a Fleet of Planes From the Sky
